author.name: Matter
author.description: On a quest to build the perfect reader.\n\nWall of love: https://t.co/rLtrjQOTXj

html:
New celestial Matter icon 💫

With our 'M' mark, tricky to strike the right balance between visual interest and staying refined. @Gavmn nailed it. Beautiful work, as he does.

Credit too to @generosss  for the 'M dot' pattern that's carried through here. https://t.co/lxnM4Bk1Pp

author.name: Linus
author.description: thought & craft · ex @replit @hackclub @dormroomfund

html: Long prompt chain programs, where information is flowing through prompts to be transformed at each step, feels like a pretty natural fit for this kind of nodes-and-wires canvas interface. 👇 https://t.co/pp6ssyn13X

author.name: Linus
author.description: thought & craft · ex @replit @hackclub @dormroomfund

html: Oh, and with this tool you can make this program on canvas and just get an API you can ping to use it! Which is pretty neat.

author.name: mymind
author.description:
An extension for your mind.

A private place for everything you care about. Enhanced with AI.

→ https://t.co/fhwN3pSzUb

html:
Hello friends!

Our latest iOS app update now supports both a dark mode and a light mode for the native share panel (depending on your iOS brightness setting).

We also re-designed the share panel confirmation and added some delightful animations.

Try it out! https://t.co/qEU2Julgmi

author.name: Riley Goodside
author.description: I'm good at talking to GPT-3. Previously Data Scientist @Grindr, @okcupid.

html: "Chain of chain-of-thought" — A zero-shot GPT-3 prompt that sequentially solves 15 problems with references to prior answers, using chain-of-thought deduction for each, in a single text generation.\n\nGenerated at temperature=0. Playground link: https://t.co/cMpb80fCuV https://t.co/OfrCGQwcwS
